channel.title: politics on TechnoStreet
channel.description: Recent content in politics on TechnoStreet

item.title: With Rahul, Kejriwal As Modi Challengers, Hindutva, UCC BJP's Trump Cards, 2023 Will Be A Build-Up Year
item.description: With Rahul, Kejriwal As Modi Challengers, Hindutva, UCC BJP’s Trump Cards, 2023 Will Be A Build-Up Year Congress is trying to improve its ‘product’ to make it acceptable but there is another challenger on the horizon in Arvind Kejriwal… As for BJP, nationalism and Hindutva remain its trump cards in 2023 year as well, in the run-up to the general elections

item.title: Rahul didn't visit Narasimha Rao's statue due to security reasons: Goud
item.description: Rahul didn’t visit Narasimha Rao’s statue due to security reasons: Goud A day after PV Narasimha Rao's grandson NV Subhash alleged that Rahul Gandhi "

item.title: Cong Leadership Will Find Way to Resolve Rajasthan Infighting: Jairam Ramesh
item.description: Cong Leadership Will Find Way to Resolve Rajasthan Infighting: Jairam Ramesh The party faces a tussle for power in Rajasthan between Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot and his former deputy Sachin Pilot.

item.title: If Needed, Law Against 'Love Jihad' to Be Made Stronger to Protect Interests of Tribal Women: MP CM
item.description: If Needed, Law Against ‘Love Jihad’ to Be Made Stronger to Protect Interests of Tribal Women: MP CM Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan was addressing a gathering of tribal people here on the death anniversary of tribal freedom fighter Tantya Bhil.

item.title: AICC General Secretary KC Venugopal Injured After Bharat Jodo Yatra Stampede in Indore
item.description: AICC General Secretary KC Venugopal Injured After Bharat Jodo Yatra Stampede in Indore The stampede reportedly occurred due to the police personnel's failure to control a huddle formed to meet Rahul Gandhi

item.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra Heads for Ujjain in MP; Rahul Gandhi Seen Riding Bicycle Briefly
item.description: Bharat Jodo Yatra Heads for Ujjain in MP; Rahul Gandhi Seen Riding Bicycle Briefly The yatra, a mass contact initiative of the Congress, will cover a distance of 380 km in the Malwa-Nimar region of western Madhya Pradesh in 12 days before entering Rajasthan on December 4

item.title: Just a Small Chunk of Flesh, Says Lalu's Daughter Who Decides to Donate Her Kidney to RJD Chief
item.description: Just a Small Chunk of Flesh, Says Lalu’s Daughter Who Decides to Donate Her Kidney to RJD Chief In her early 40s, the elder sister of Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav, came out with a series of emotional tweets on Friday, a day after the world came to know about her willingness to donate a kidney to her ailing father.

item.title: Himachal polls: Are political parties' promises in line with voters' needs?

item.title: BJP, RSS convert fear into hate between religions and castes: Rahul Gandhi
item.description: BJP, RSS convert fear into hate between religions and castes: Rahul Gandhi 'Slamming the Centre over demonetization, Rahul Gandhi said that the BJP government's decision destroyed poor farmers, small businessmen, shop owners and others'

item.title: 'Pawar's participation in 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will depend on his health'
item.description: ‘Pawar’s participation in ‘Bharat Jodo Yatra’ will depend on his health’ Senior Congress leader Ashok Chavan has said the participation of Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) chief Sharad Pawar in the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Maharashtra will depend on his health condition.

item.title: As Meghalaya, Nagaland head for elections, there is unrest in the air
item.description: As Meghalaya, Nagaland head for elections, there is unrest in the air When pundits are sceptical about Naga peace talks but all parties are united in seeking resolution of the issue before assembly polls, ethnic troubles may cause the situation to heat up in Meghalaya

item.title: Congress will win Himachal Pradesh assembly polls, says Chhattisgarh CM
item.description: Congress will win Himachal Pradesh assembly polls, says Chhattisgarh CM Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Bhagel on Saturday expressed his confidence that the Congress will win the Assembly polls in Himachal Pradesh

item.title: As momentum builds up for state polls, MP BJP chief may get extension
item.description: As momentum builds up for state polls, MP BJP chief may get extension The two-year tenure of Madhya Pradesh BJP president VD Sharma will end by February 2023, around eight months before the next assembly polls, scheduled in November next year

item.title: Central govt responsible for stubble burning spike, says Delhi CM Kejriwal
item.description: Central govt responsible for stubble burning spike, says Delhi CM Kejriwal Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday blamed the central government for rising incidents of stubble burning in Punjab and said it should "

item.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra is bringing about silent revolution: Mallikarjun Kharge
item.description: Bharat Jodo Yatra is bringing about silent revolution: Mallikarjun Kharge The Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra is bringing about a silent revolution that will change the political landscape, party chief Mallikarjun Kharge said on Wednesday.

item.title: AAP govt sends "Red Light On, Gaddi Off" file back again to L-G Saxena
item.description: AAP govt sends “Red Light On, Gaddi Off” file back again to L-G Saxena Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Monday said that the file answering all questions raised by LG regarding the campaign has been sent

item.description: Polling Underway for Zila Parishad, Panchayat Samitis in 9 Haryana Districts in 1st Phase As many as 49,67,092 voters in nine districts are eligible to exercise their vote in the first phase of polling, for which 6,019 polling booths have been set up

item.title: Delhi LG asks CM Arvind Kejriwal to revisit 'Red Light On, Gaddi Off' drive
item.description: Delhi LG asks CM Arvind Kejriwal to revisit ‘Red Light On, Gaddi Off’ drive Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena called out the lies and bluff being publicised by Delhi Minister Gopal Rai and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal pertaining to the "

item.title: Maharashtra minister blames MVA for Tata-Airbus project moving to Gujarat
item.description: Maharashtra minister blames MVA for Tata-Airbus project moving to Gujarat Maharashtra Industries Minister Uday Samant on Saturday said the previous Maha Vikas Agahdi government under Uddhav Thackeray did not take any decision on the Tata-Airbus military transport aircraft project, the moving of which to neighbouring Gujarat had started a political slugfest in the state.

item.title: The Magnetism of Muthuramalinga Thevar, His Bond with Bose, And His Touch in Tamil Nadu Politics
item.description: The Magnetism of Muthuramalinga Thevar, His Bond with Bose, And His Touch in Tamil Nadu Politics The annual Thevar Jayanti event is to be held on October 30 to celebrate the birth anniversary of the freedom fighter, Congress and Forward Bloc leader

item.title: Kejriwal writes to PM Modi for Lakshmi-Ganesh photos on currency notes
item.description: Kejriwal writes to PM Modi for Lakshmi-Ganesh photos on currency notes Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal, who created a political flutter with his appeal to incorporate images of Goddess Lakshmi and Lord Ganesha on currency notes, has written a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi pushing forward the demand.

item.title: Mallikarjun Kharge's election will galvanise Congress, says DK Shivakumar
item.description: Mallikarjun Kharge’s election will galvanise Congress, says DK Shivakumar As veteran Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge took over as the party chief, Karnataka Congress president DK Shivakumar on Thursday said Kharge's election will galvanise the Congress

item.title: Injured Nitish Kumar ditches steamer, rides a car to inspect ghats
item.description: Injured Nitish Kumar ditches steamer, rides a car to inspect ghats Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Wednesday hit the road to inspect ghats along the river Ganges in the state capital which will be teeming with crowds for the next few days as part of Chhath festivities.

item.title: My govt is inclusive, committed to Maharashtra's development: Shinde
item.description: My govt is inclusive, committed to Maharashtra’s development: Shinde Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said his government was committed to all-round development of the state and after taking charge three months ago, he has taken welfare measures for various sections of the society, including farmers and senior citizens.

item.title: Height of U-turn, says BJP on Kejriwal's bid for Gods' images on currency
item.description: Height of U-turn, says BJP on Kejriwal’s bid for Gods' images on currency The BJP on Wednesday cited past comments of Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal to claim that his demand for having images of Lord Ganesha and Goddess Lakshmi on currency notes is the height of U-turn as he is "

item.title: Kerala guv writes to CM Vijayan, wants finance minister Balagopal sacked
item.description: Kerala guv writes to CM Vijayan, wants finance minister Balagopal sacked Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan, in a letter to Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan on Wednesday, informed that he has "

item.title: BJP-Shinde to contest some civic polls separately, others jointly: Fadnavis
item.description: BJP-Shinde to contest some civic polls separately, others jointly: Fadnavis Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday said the ruling BJP and Shiv Sena faction led by Chief Minister Eknath Shinde will contest some of the civic polls separately and others in alliance.

item.title: Amit Shah meets BJP leaders from Saurashtra ahead of Gujarat polls
item.description: Amit Shah meets BJP leaders from Saurashtra ahead of Gujarat polls Union Home Minister and senior BJP leader Amit Shah on Tuesday met party leaders from the Saurashtra region of Gujarat to formulate strategy for the coming Assembly elections in the state.

item.title: Uddhav Thackeray likely to join Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maharashtra: Report
item.description: Uddhav Thackeray likely to join Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maharashtra: Report Shiv Sena-UBT President and former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray is likely to join Congress leader Rahul Gandhi Bharat Jodo Yatra when it reaches the state

item.title: Wheel of fortune turned full circle: Karnataka CM Bommai on Sunak's win
item.description: Wheel of fortune turned full circle: Karnataka CM Bommai on Sunak’s win Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Monday expressed happiness after Indian-origin British Conservative party politician Rishi Sunak made his way to the post of UK Prime Minister.

item.title: Coimbatore cylinder blast' shows state intelligence failure: TN BJP chief
item.description: Coimbatore cylinder blast' shows state intelligence failure: TN BJP chief Questioning the DMK govt for state intelligence failure as Coimbatore Cylinder blast, Tamil Nadu BJP President K Annamalai claimed that it was a terror attack with ISIS link

item.title: Former Rajya Sabha member Rapolu Anand Bhaskar quits BJP, to join TRS
item.description: Former Rajya Sabha member Rapolu Anand Bhaskar quits BJP, to join TRS BJP leader in Telangana, Rapolu Ananda Bhaskar on Sunday called on TRS president and Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao and expressed his keenness to join the ruling party.

item.title: Karnataka Guv gives assent to ordinance increasing SC, ST reservation
item.description: Karnataka Guv gives assent to ordinance increasing SC, ST reservation Karnataka Governor Thaawarchand Gehlot gave his assent to the ordinance increasing the reservation for the Scheduled Castes from 15% to 17% and the Scheduled Tribes from 3% to 7% in the state

item.title: PM Modi lauds Kohli for spectacular innings in India's win over Pakistan
item.description: PM Modi lauds Kohli for spectacular innings in India’s win over Pakistan Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday congratulated the Indian cricket team on its win over Pakistan in the T-20 World Cup and lauded Virat Kohli for his "

item.description: Downpour of announcements, drought in implementation:Uddhav slams Maha govt Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday demanded the Maharashtra government declare "

item.title: Karnataka minister apologises after viral video shows him slapping woman
item.description: Karnataka minister apologises after viral video shows him slapping woman Karnataka Minister V Somanna apologised on Sunday after he allegedly slapped a woman who approached him with a plea to redress her grievance.

item.title: Gandhi family, its NGOs not above law: BJP on cancellation of FCRA licences
item.description: Gandhi family, its NGOs not above law: BJP on cancellation of FCRA licences The BJP on Sunday welcomed the cancellation of the FCRA licences of two NGOs headed by former Congress president Sonia Gandhi, and said the Gandhi family and organisations linked to them can't be above law.

item.title: Rahul Gandhi to attend Congress Prez-elect Kharge's coronation on Wednesday
item.description: Rahul Gandhi to attend Congress Prez-elect Kharge’s coronation on Wednesday Rahul Gandhi will be attending President-elect Mallikarjun Kharge's coronation as Congress chief on Wednesday while the Bharat Jodo Yatra has taken a Diwali break

item.title: Gujarat BJP targets Kejriwal over cracker ban in Delhi
item.description: Gujarat BJP targets Kejriwal over cracker ban in Delhi Rajkot: Gujarat BJP chief C R Paatil has hit out at Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal over his government’s decision to completely ban firecrackers in the national capital, and dubbed such people “anti-religious” who were stopping citizens from celebrating their festivals.

item.description: ‘Anti-religious’: Gujarat BJP targets Kejriwal over cracker ban in Delhi Gujarat BJP chief C R Paatil has hit out at Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal over his government's decision to completely ban firecrackers in the national capital, and dubbed such people "

item.title: Guv Arif keeps blowing hot, but CM Pinarayi says 'This is Kerala'
item.description: Guv Arif keeps blowing hot, but CM Pinarayi says ‘This is Kerala’ 'Ethu Keralam aanu (This is Kerala) is the stock phrase that CM Pinarayi uses time and again, mostly when he wants to lash out either at the Centre or at his now bete noire - Governor Arif

item.title: No end in sight to tug-of-war between Jharkhand Governor, Soren govt
item.description: No end in sight to tug-of-war between Jharkhand Governor, Soren govt The role of Syed Sibte Razi had sparked intense controversy in 2005 when he administered the oath of chief ministership to Shibu Soren, the leader of the UPA

item.title: Tussle between Punjab Governor, AAP govt over Ludhiana VC turns murkier
item.description: Tussle between Punjab Governor, AAP govt over Ludhiana VC turns murkier The latest in a series of confrontations is Governor Purohit's directive to CM Bhagwant Mann to remove Satbir Singh Gosal from the post of Ludhiana-based Punjab Agricultural University Vice-Chancellor

item.title: BJP pushes MBBS in Hindi; Madhya Pradesh Congress questions timing of move
item.description: BJP pushes MBBS in Hindi; Madhya Pradesh Congress questions timing of move The Congress has questioned the timing of the project as the assembly elections in the state are scheduled in November-December 2023

item.description: Hefty loss to MCD due to parking fee collection irregularities, alleges AAP The AAP on Saturday claimed that the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) suffered a big "

item.title: BJP objects to massive crowd during Vikramaditya Singh’s nomination, approaches ECI
item.description: BJP objects to massive crowd during Vikramaditya Singh’s nomination, approaches ECI Shimla: Irked over witnessing a massive crowd during the nomination of former six-time Chief Minister Virbhadra Singh and MLA Vikramaditya Singh has made Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), the party has approached the election commission and has filed a complaint against Singh.

item.title: Sonia, Rahul, Kharge on list of 40-star campaigners for Himachal poll
item.description: Sonia, Rahul, Kharge on list of 40-star campaigners for Himachal poll Shimla: Newly elected President of the All India Congress Committee (AICC), Mallikarjun Kharge, former Presidents Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi and Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will be the star campaigners of Congress in the state.

item.title: AAP slams MCD, BJP over parking fee collection irregularity
item.description: AAP slams MCD, BJP over parking fee collection irregularity Hefty loss to MCD due to parking fee collection irregularities alleges Aam Aadmi Party.

item.title: No fine for flouting traffic rules in Gujarat during Diwali; Owaisi slams
item.description: No fine for flouting traffic rules in Gujarat during Diwali; Owaisi slams No fines will be collected from from traffic rules violators till October 27 in view of Diwali festivities, the Gujarat government has announced.

item.title: On Diwali-eve, 800 Maharashtra youth get job letters; MVA slams BJP govt
item.description: On Diwali-eve, 800 Maharashtra youth get job letters; MVA slams BJP govt Three union ministers -- Piyush Goyal, Narayan Rane and Ramdas Athawale presented appointment letters to various Central government jobs at separate functions held in Mumbai, Pune and Nagpur

item.title: Shah meets with BJP leaders, workers of Gujarat to review poll preparations
item.description: Shah meets with BJP leaders, workers of Gujarat to review poll preparations Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday held a meeting with BJP leaders and workers of south Gujarat zone to review preparations for the upcoming state Assembly elections, dates of which are yet to be announced.

item.title: Congress fields Jagat from Kinnaur, Gaur from Manali
item.description: Congress fields Jagat from Kinnaur, Gaur from Manali Shimla: Indian National Congress has issued its third list of candidates for four Legislative Assembly Constituencies and once again has fielded four-time MLA Jagat Singh Negi (ST) as its candidate from Kinnaur.
